display_title.display_title:
Congo, Republic of - Economic
            Recovery Credit Project : Update on the Program Document

docna.cdata!:
Congo, Republic of - Economic Recovery
            Credit Project : Update on the Program Document

repnme.cdata!:
Congo, Republic of - Economic Recovery
            Credit Project : Update on the Program Document

subtopic: Environmental Economics & Policies,Banks & Banking Reform,Public Sector Economics,National Governance,Strategic Debt Management

abstracts.cdata!:
This note provides information on
            developments which took place since the Project Document
            (PGD), dated July 29, 2004 was distributed to the Board. The
            overall macroeconomic framework (Section III B in the PGD)
            has slightly improved, in particular, the projected annual
            growth of non-oil GDP over 2005-07 has been revised upwards,
            from 4.9 percent to 5.3 percent on account of the projected
            secondary effects of higher oil output, and prices. There
            has been significant progress with Paris Club creditors over
            a series of meetings, notably on October 13, and November
            16, 2004. On the whole, creditors were satisfied with the
            efforts made by the authorities, and agreed to meet with
            Congo authorities in December to negotiate a flow treatment
            on Naples terms (67 percent Net Present Value reduction)
            that will cover 100 percent of arrears, and debt service.
